name: Tower Wars
description: Tower Wars combines elements of tower defense, RTS, and all-out multi-player mayhem to bring you a completely unique experience, delivered with a fun and funny not-so-old world style!
minimum_requirements: Minimum (or Recommended) OS: Windows® XP SP3/ Windows® Vista SP2/ Windows® 7                  Processor: Dual Core processor with 2.0GHz or greater (Intel Core 2 Duo or AMD Athlon 64 X2)                 Memory: 2 GB RAM                 Hard Disk Space: 1.5 GB                  Video Card: Video Card with 512MB dedicated memory and DX9.0c support (Shader Model 3+)  *Video cards with shared memory technology are not supported.                 DirectX®: DirectX® version 9.0c                 Sound: Windows compatible sound device                 Additional: Tower Wars online ranked and unranked multiplayer matches require a broadband internet connection.

reviews.review_text: To me, Tower Wars is like a needy girlfriend. Tower Wars expects far too much from me. Defend a castle whilst producing an assault against the enemies castle? Tower Wars doesn’t know me. Tower Wars doesn't understand that I have to make a solid effort to remember the garlic bread I put in the oven whilst cooking a bolognese. Tower Wars also doesn't realise I often forget to buy spaghetti. Tower Wars, dinner is cancelled. Tower Wars, I can hardly manage tower defence or tower attack on their own, let alone both. Tower Wars, stop mocking my ability to multitask please. D:  Tower Wars can be played online, though an interesting concept for a tower defence game, I dared not try it. I lost to the base level AI, that was humiliating enough. I didn't feel like demonstrating how many ♥♥♥♥♥ I can suck at this game to online players. :C  Great game for it's price, but it's not for me!

Straighten up and get in line! Tower Wars is a unique tower defense game with a heavy emphasis on technique and planning. This isn't your grannies Bloon Wars, babies! If you're too good at the rest, come play with the best. A super-helpful and friendly community, addicting gameplay, ranked seasons where players who truly put in the effort can win fame and prizes and a delightfully whimsical Steampunk art style. The learning curve is high, but those who perservere and learn the ropes march towards glory. Be warned: You WILL get your backsides handed to you your first few rounds in multiplayer, but not to fret. The community has done a great job of creating guides and videos that are easily available to get new players up to speed, and the guy who just slaughtered you in six rounds will also more than likely be totally willing to give you a practice round or two to show you how things work. All that said, my favorite part of this game is actually the audio and voice acting. Skillfully put together, it matches the art in theme and energy, and the voices of both the King and the troops are amusing even when you're on a losing streak.

I was looking for a tower defense game wherein I could sit and play the game for more than an hour and not get bored. I found Tower Wars on sale and immediately grabbed as I'm a fan of worlds created with hexagonal terrains put together.  The game resembles Tropical Tower Wars, a custom WarCraft III map that I used to play. Instead of having a fixed pathways and a place for your towers, you create the maze yourself. The world is made out of hexagon tiles separated into different islands. Three gold mines for each team are randomly placed in the map to create diversity for your mazing strategies.   Controls
Despite numerous technical problems, Tower Wars, thanks to some original features, is a worthy exponent of the Tower Defense genre.

If you are used to Kindom Rush or PvZ, Tower Wars is going to kick your ♥♥♥! Even in easy, the AI is relentless and that makes solo games quite satisfying, but past the 5 hour mark, and you notice the same things over and over. Maybe it's the tech tree that's not very exciting, or the mechanical strategies of the AI, the lack of campaign story maybe? I still recommend it to all you tower defense fans out there, because there are not many left.

In a World where Tower Defense games flood the Market, where one is like any other with just miniscule changes there is sometimes someone trying to switch things up a little.  technically, the principle of Tower Wars has been used in tons of WarCraft 3 Maps before. but still, this is a TD game that still manages to stand out.  Because your enemy is not a set of 20 pre-made waves. It is a Human.  Yes, Tower Wars, as Avertised is a PvP tower Defense Game. And while it follows the 'Mazing' style of TDs (you have no predetermined path enemies take. you have a patch of land and the enemies will take the shortest route towards your Fortress) it also forces you to focus on how you will attack.  You gain resources by killing enemies and having your people waddle as far as they can.  Now the Towers and Enemies are where the fun starts. You are not presented with the standart 'Normal tower/ Faster but weaker tower/Splash Tower/Slow Tower' variety, but rather towers that focus on different kinds of Health as well as some supporting towers, like a wind turbine that slows enemies in its path or a huge pot that throws boiling oil to all its sides. As far as the offensive units go, you go from the why do I worry-kind of standart waddler, faster waddlers, healing waddlers, shielding waddlers, carrying waddlers, as well as Upgrades for them. in the end I believe you stand with as many supporting units as you have actual damaging units.  Rounds may be short (if any of the players really messes up his BO) or can draw out to a 2 hour 'We all send a full wave of our biggest units, all fully upgraded through each others maze and look what happens'-Stalemate. but even those are fun, because its like a snail race. In the end you only win or lose by a hairs width.  Also, Bots in 10 difficulty flavors have been implemented. So if you cant find a match (or just wanna get back in form) you can always challenge one of those to get your TD Madness on
Dead game, no updates. Why did I buy this, mistakes were made.
A lovely game tbh :) Get it if you miss the good old Tower Wars games in War 3 ^^
not bad for a few $$, quite fun, co-op is a bit vanilla, but vs is complex and fun

5.8/10 - Marathon of Tower Defense  The gameplay is pretty good on this one. Graphics are better than most. Matches can be extremely long though.(Over an hour) This really turns me off though. Waves come every 45 seconds and it takes too long for any satisfaction.   Worth $5     Accidently Reviewed

FlynnLives Sep 1, 2012 10 FINALLY! Someone made an actual Tower Wars game! The mods were so much fun, so it's awesome that SuperVillain made an actual game to pretty much officially kick off the genre (I think?)! Basically, not only do you set up your towers and maze to defend, but you send out your own armies to attack the other castle! Lots of units to unlock and upgrade by using an RTS system (tech tree). And the humor is a nice touch too. Who doesn't love a robot named Stanley Clunkerbottom? The meat of the experience is the multi-player for sure! It supports local hosted and ranked matches, so you can play with friends until you're ready to head out into a ranked match. 2v2 is probably my favorite, and the game goes all the way up to 3v3 (and 1v1 of course). And there IS a single player 'Classic' mode, which is like other normal Tower Defense games where you just defend as long as you can. But this thing REALLY shines in multi-player modes that it's built for!  And, for what it's worth, the game is gorgeous if you have a gaming PC with some muscle. But it also lets you customize all settings for weaker machines too, and even looks pretty good at lower settings. Looks like a miniatures set up! I want to play this in real life!  Highly recommended for fans of Tower Defense, RTSs, Table-Top Games, or multi-player with friends! Oh, and for $10? No brainer!
Great Tower defence game.

I love this game, it is the main reason i got steam in the first place simply because the concept of tower defence being combined with multiplayer and the rarely seen tower attack gameplay is just incredible, and especially since now there are bots you can play against instead of only other players, it is that much more fun for me now that i can practice.
Quite a fun and hard game, gets really interesting when you start playing against other people. Even though the bots are a good enough challenge (atleast for me :p)
fun game, needs two people for fullest enjoyment. playing against AI in this game is like playing starcraft or such against ai.. kinda fun but not near the fun when playing a human
I think would be A good game for all you tower defence lovers        I'm 8
This game is a blast!!

Can't recommend this game to TD fans. Because it is not a classic TD (except few levels for best time matches). It is an online ranked matches game where you attack and defence at the same time. Interesting idea, but not a TD. Also, no matter how many towers you build or upgrade, you can't stop a single wave and this is a disappointing experience for a TD game..
Good clean fun easly worth £5
Really cool new concept for TD's. Getting to build towers AND send out monsters against your opponent's towers add a whole new level of strategy to this game.
A nice blend of RTS and Tower Defense. If you get it on the cheap off of Steam, all the better. The game itself is tough, but that could be because I suck at it. Regardless, it's pretty fun.
Pretty awesome, and addictive.

I've always been a fan of tower denfense but, this one is awesome! The controls can use some work (I don't like the circle where you choose the tower or upgrade it) but the game all in all is otherwise great! It still needs some more maps though.
Fun tower defense game would be better with friends (as I have none) solo is still fun and there are many difficulties.

Good game but still needs lots of improvement especially on its multiplayer department. It's versus bots coop there's only 1 map which sucks because playing together with friends was supposedly what should make this game fun. I suggest putting a map where the AI would also build towers and send troops in coop mode not just in campaign/single player mode.

I love Tower Defense games so much, and this game is REALLY FUN if you enjoy TD games.   One of the greatest features of this game is you have to actively send out 'creeps' against your opponent while still maintaining your own tower defense line. You also have to manage your income in the form of mines (you can upgrade them task more miners)  The upgrading is very basic, max level 3 for towers; however, there is a good amount of diversity for the macro-upgrading trees. For this, you have to spend both money AND battle points. You get battle points by sending troops out (most likely to die), so playing defensively might not be the best option if your oppnent is beating you in gold and battlepoint revenue.  You can use your towers to make mazes for the creep to pass through, and the feedback showing exactly where the creeps will travel is really helpful. Admittedly, I've taken lessons from the AI's layout.   The learning curve is pretty good despite the extra mechanics, I think the only thing people need to be aware of is how critical getting battlepoints is - balancing your income is key. There is no point of having 10000+ gold if you're waiting on your battlepoints to upgrade your stuff.  Aesthetically, the game is very nice and charming. I'm used to towers getting the most insignificant aesthetic changes in old school TD games, but all of the towers here come with their own newer, badder look. The feedback for enemy health, movement, etc is very seamless - so you can still keep track of how much damage you're doing despite 100 catapults shrouding an enemy (pretty good tactic in all TDs actually - artillery for the win!)  For the price, I would definitely recommend getting it, especially if you're a fan of tower defense games!
Always loved Tower Defese games, but this allows you to control both sides, attacking and defending, at the same time! If you love Tower Defense games, then you should give this a try :D

This is a tower defence game. You build a maze and enemys run throu it. There are the normal tower defence and the 1v1 tower defence. The normal is nothing realy specialy but then again it is good to know that I am bad at tower defence. But 1v1 is intressting.  1v1: Here you play another player you build your maze but you also send minions in to your opponents maze so you have to carefuly balance your resorces and think about how much is worth sending in cause if you send to weak units your enemy just get easie reasurces.  Maps: There is if you ask me abit to few maps so if you pick random you have a big chance of playing the same over and over but on the possetive side is that your mines thjat give you gold are not placed in the same way every time so you have to adapt to each layout.  Summery and own thoughts: It is fun to play 1v1 but other then that it is a tower defence and I am bad at them so I am not the best judge of this game but it has fun gameplay varried units and towers. If you are going to pick this up play it with a friend you will have alot more fun. Good luck and defend your castle.
My wife beat me 3x in a row. Great game.
it's good Tower Defense game !

I have a GTX 760 and an i5 3570k, and I get constant drops below 30, which to me is unnaceptable. It suffers heavily from optimizaton issues, and I really hope to see the game fixed soon, because it is a lot of fun, but I cannot excuse poor preformance in a game that is not graphically intensive at all.
Great game. Simple, fun, exciting.

Still testing this one but still, had been a while, since Wintermaul Wars, a game like this was done. Tbh I'm a huge fan of Tower Defense and this was a much awaited game for me. Will likely review it again once I experience the content.

as the name states, its a tower defense game. got it from a bundle so i was curious how it is.  well the graphics are sweet, thats the good part. there are only 3 different maps, and they arent so large either so it gets boring after a short amount of time. the controls are weird and annoying if youre trying to build fast.  the tutorial for noobs only explains the basics, multiplayer seems to be dead already. when youre lucky to find a match, you either play vs a complete autist or a 578347593845 skill guy whos playing day&night. = pretty bad matchmaking.   maybe its fun in coop, but all together its far away from being as good as warcraft 3 tower defense mods that i loved to play.  7€ are not much, but because of the few maps and dead multiplayer, even this seems to be overpriced.
I cant even play this ♥♥♥♥ing piece of ♥♥♥♥.

If you want to win, spend some time on the internet to discover the couple of build orders it takes to win. There is no strategy involved, just be the fastest to click on the correct buttons at the appropriate time. A champanzee could be trained to play the game.

Atleast it only cost me £2.74 for me and my friend, I would have been way more upset if I payed the full price of £10.99.  Steam really should sort its stuff out, this company shouldnt be able to continue to sell on this platform.

Great theme, steampunk with great graphics. Unfortunately... very limited gameplay. Once you figure out an ideal build order 'script' you can blow past the entire single-player game quite easily and very repetitively.

I don't recommend it because of one big flaw:  The game is not made for pc gaming (Mouse + keyboard) . It seems to be only 'optimised' for touch screen.  Let me show you:  Screenshot   To build a tower you have to click and hold the mouse button, then you have to circle through a menu and release the button. Hoping you did not select the wrong one. The same setup is done for upgrading and selling, which can often lead to annoying situations.  I don't like my games to be tedious. I do not understand why there is no option to change the settings: Upgrade -> shortcut u, sell -> shortcut s. Simple stuff like this. The game is quite fast paced and the interaction to build/upgrade/sell a tower is really slow because of this setup.  Furthermore, I do not find the towers very balanced. The costs seem extremely mixed. Rather than different towers with different effects for roughly the same cost (Think of Kingdom Rush). So diversification of towers is more a cost matter than what troops the enemy sends you.  As a result, this game could not interest me. As reflected in my playing time.
Yes.... Yesss.... YEEEESSSS!!!!
I could nto even play a tutorial withou a dam bug ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off....

The 1vs1 online is hard to, you have to wait until 30 min if you are lucky.  If you read this and trust me, call me. I would like to play this game more! Thanks for reading!

I played a tower defense survival map. made all towers I possibly could. leveled up everything on the map as mutch as i could. alt tabbed and looked at game reviews. I literaly did this for half an hour. I hear my base being messed up.  go back into the game. see the enemy die. meh keep on looking at reviews. more attacking this time I ignore. wait another 10 minutes. come back in time to see the game asking me how i'm still going. look at more reviews. get called for work. ... ... ... come back to find I lasted an hour and five minutes and got an acheivement. best game ever.
Fun and exciting.
Very Challenging Bots and Nice Graphics  Its definately one of the Best Towerdefense Game i played so far

This is the most unique tower defense game I have played, particularly in that, while having to defend against a stream of mobs, you send your own out for your enemy to defend against at the same time. It is hectic and intense, but the game looks and plays great.   There is, of course, a classic tower defense mode as well. It's a ton of fun, but I do wish there were more maps to choose from.   The game looks and feels like Warcraft 3 in a way, but it plays like Defense Grid with hexes rather than squares. I love it!
Love this game. Just like a great TD game that includes lots of different unit building as well. Amazing to play with friends using the multiplayer.

All Winter Maul (from Warcraft 3 custom maps) lovers are going to enjoy this game.   It's a competive Tower Defense that allows you to maze, and send waves of minions over to your opponent. The beauty about being able to play against actual players is that is never gets dull. You get to see new strategies and such.   There's also a co-op mode that lets you and your friend(s) fight waves of pirates together. I thought it was impossible to complete, because a big ♥♥♥ wizard keeps appearing and destroying your towers, making your maze completely useless, but I found a video on YouTube and found out that it actually possible to complete.   Tower Defense fans should definitely give this game a go!

Heck of a lot harder than it looks. Really fun building defence and running the gauntlet at the same time. However their verson of a 'wet-blankie' enemy had me screaming in frustraition at only the 2nd game in. Was hoping for a slightly more casual take before the angry 'i'm never playing again' kicked in. I reccomend it fully, but hope you have better luck kicking the bad guy's butt.

I'm new to real time strategy and thought I would start with this game, unfortunately it didn't turn out too well and would strongly discourage buying it if you too are new real time strategy. It might just be me too but I found the game incredibly difficult (though judging from other reviews I'm not alone), I personally wasn't even able to beat the first level with where you battle against a plank, that's right, A PLANK!  Aside from the difficultly, the game did have some rather humorous moments and the I really liked the graphic style and the tutorial level did a really nice job of explaining things.  Other than that I would like to include another person's review, Drunk Bear Man, because it sums up how I feel about the game as well:  '6/10  It's a unique kind of mix-up to the Tower Defense genre, where you have to defend using towers like always... AND send out units to act as enemies FOR the opposing team, who has to defend themselves by building their OWN towers. If it would have been a perfect game, it would have gotten a 10 for a really cool mix-up of the genre. But sadly, it's far from perfect. This game has a VERY steep learning curve, and when it was first released it had virtually no singleplayer until they updated it, but guess what? The first bot for singleplayer is hard if you don't know what the hell to do, and the description for it says otherwise! Also, there isn't that much variation and only 10 bots to fight against, meaning this game is predominantly multiplayer, which I honeslty don't like for the TD genre. '

Have you ever wanted to revisit WC3 TD mods? Well, this game is all about that, with the twist of organizing the waves to go into your enemies waves yourself. You'll have to figure out your maze on the fly, and with the slighty randomized landscape each playthrough, you won't be able to pull off exactly the same super efficent maze that you did the game before this one, keeping things fresh and forcing you to think. Not to mention you'll have to mull over the best way to line up units to abuse your opponent's maze, with plenty of unit variety and specs to give you a wide variety of options and dirty things to try to slip through it.  It's a great game, but it's best played as single games between long periods. The games can go rather long if both people are competent. Still very much reccommended, but you might want to wait for a sale.
Gem TD , Classic TD, Cat War in 1 game ... If you love create your own maze, build and upgrade, and send your own wave to destroy the enemy base... PLAY this game !
Extremely fun game, only issue is the game freezes when trying to load. With a little patients, its amazing.
